Job Title: Stewarding Supervisor 

Location: Denver, CO

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Organization- Grand Hyatt Denver

Summary

At Hyatt, we believe our guests select Hyatt because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing efficient service and meaningful experiences.

The responsibilities of the Stewarding Supervisor at the Grand Hyatt Denver include assisting in any area in the Stewarding Division. They are expected to support leadership by developing and assuming basic management responsibilities. This role leads other associates by coaching, giving direction, training and scheduling. Other duties may include total maintenance and sanitation in all food production service areas, assisting with culinary plate up, delivering food to hotel banquet space, and accounting for the hotel's china inventory. This role has a direct impact on creating memorable guest experiences.

This position requires open availability, any day of the week, including weekends and holidays.

Our Values: Empathy / Wellbeing / Respect / Integrity / Experimentation / Inclusion

Grand Hyatt Denver is seeking colleagues with unmatched service.  We care for people so they can be their best. 

Hyatt associates work in an environment that demands exceptional performance yet reaps great rewards. Whether its career opportunities, job enrichment or a supportive work environment, if you are ready for this challenge, then we are ready for you.

Qualifications

Qualifications for this position:

 A true desire to satisfy the needs of others in a fast-paced environment.  Refined verbal and written communication skills.  Ability to stand for long periods of time and walk moderate distances.  Must be able to work a flexible schedule, including weekends and holidays. 

Benefits available with this position:

 Medical/ Dental/ Vision Insurance after 30 days  Free basic Life Insurance after 30 days  Free basic Short Term Disability after 30 days  Eligible to participate in a Flexible Spending Account after 30 days  Vacation/ Sick Days  7 Paid Holidays  1 Floating Holiday per calendar year  Complimentary Room Nights 12 per calendar year after 90 days  Employee/Friends & Family Rate Room Nights  Employee may elect to contribute 401k after 30 days  401k Match: 1-3% = dollar/dollar, 4-5% = $.50/dollar after 1 year  Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) 5% discount  Contribute to the 529 Education Savings Plan  Educational Reimbursement: $1,000/per calendar year  Jury Duty  Bereavement Pay  Free Light Rail/Bus Pass  Complimentary meal in Grand Bistro  Use of Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 

The rate for this position is $22.00 /hr.

This application window is anticipated to be open at a maximum of 30 days. Applications will be review in the order in which they are received.

Hyatt is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Marital Status

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
